events.message:
test: re-enable CLI test support by using EncodeDecimal in json.dumps()

As mentioned in
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17675#issuecomment-563188648

events.body:
Thanks for following up on this!

ACK b6f9e3576a1ea18572e4803aeb3f39330f0cb759 assuming Travis is happy too -- diff looks correct :)

> ACK b6f9e35 assuming Travis is happy too -- diff looks correct :)

travis doesn't run with `--usecli`
@MarcoFalke I think it does for `wallet_multiwallet.py`, `wallet_createwallet.py`, `wallet_watchonly.py` and `rpc_deriveaddresses.py`? :)

> @MarcoFalke I think it does for wallet_multiwallet.py, wallet_createwallet.py, wallet_watchonly.py and rpc_deriveaddresses.py? :)

Yeah, but none of these files are touched in this pull
@MarcoFalke They all use `arg_to_cli` which is touched by this pull, no? :)

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,6 +190,11 @@ def check_json_precision():
     if satoshis != 2000000000000003:
         raise RuntimeError("JSON encode/decode loses precision")
 
+def EncodeDecimal(o):
+    if isinstance(o, Decimal):
+        return str(o)
+    raise TypeError(repr(o) + " is not JSON serializable")
comments.body: Any reason why this is duplicated from the identical function in authproxy?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,6 +190,11 @@ def check_json_precision():
     if satoshis != 2000000000000003:
         raise RuntimeError("JSON encode/decode loses precision")
 
+def EncodeDecimal(o):

comments.body: There were include issues running tests directly when I moved the authproxy usage into util. I can take another look.
